CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The trend in the V OC of the PSCs can be explained by the HOMO energy level of the polymers because the V OC is typically linearly proportional to the difference in energy between the HOMO of the polymer and the LUMO of the acceptor.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PSCs (Polymer Solar Cells) |
| the HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital) of the polymers |
| the LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital) of the acceptor |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The trend in the V OC of the PSCs can be explained by the HOMO energy level of the polymers because the V OC is typically linearly proportional to the difference in energy between the HOMO of the polymer and the LUMO of the acceptor.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| V OC |
| HOMO energy level of the polymers |
| V OC |
| difference in energy |
| HOMO of the polymer |
| LUMO of the acceptor |

Explanation:

* V OC: Stands for "Open Circuit Voltage." Mentioned twice in the paragraph.
* HOMO energy level of the polymers: HOMO stands for "Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital." Mentioned as a property of polymers.
* V OC: Stands for "Open Circuit Voltage." Mentioned again in the paragraph.
* Difference in energy: Mentioned as a property between the HOMO of the polymer and the LUMO of the acceptor.
* HOMO of the polymer: Stands for "Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital" of the polymer. Mentioned as a property of the polymer.
* LUMO of the acceptor: Stands for "Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital" of the acceptor. Mentioned as a property of the acceptor.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| HOMO energy level of the polymers |
| difference in energy |
| HOMO of the polymer |
| LUMO of the acceptor |

Explanation:

* HOMO energy level of the polymers: HOMO stands for "Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital." Mentioned as a property of polymers.
* Difference in energy: Mentioned as a property between the HOMO of the polymer and the LUMO of the acceptor.
* HOMO of the polymer: Stands for "Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital" of the polymer. Mentioned as a property of the polymer.
* LUMO of the acceptor: Stands for "Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital" of the acceptor. Mentioned as a property of the acceptor.

The other entities, V OC (Open Circuit Voltage), do not clearly refer to a material property and were removed.
